caption: Growing up near this place, I have to say that this church has a nice history and that Don Bosco was the patron saint of education. It is a nice place to seek spiritual refuge and the stained glass windows are very nice. A guided tour is given every month. The staff of the church are also very responsive by phone and I advise anyone seeking information to contact them since they even called me back when I left a voice message. Their website is also very helpful.
Beautiful and different from the churches in the center of Paris.
Nice local church, Sunday mass at 1030hrs and 1900hrs weekday, but best check on website
Beautiful church Art Nouveau style. Weekday catholic masses at 7PM.
Very interesting 30ies church
Outstanding example of late Art Deco style (1930s’)
Very impressive but beautyful church.
Lovely church marrying modern and classical architecture.
Kind of a magical place. I recommend it !

Church which is nothing extraordinary seen from the outside, but whose interior is beautiful and bright. Large modern stained glass windows with intense colors, beautiful mosaics, and a very well done and interesting exhibition of the life and work of Saint John Bosco. Also a beautiful baptistery. I recommend visiting it and praying there if you feel like it.
Art Deco church richly decorated with mosaics and stained glass windows

The Don Bosco church, located in the 20th arrondissement of Paris, is a true architectural gem. Its modern and daring style contrasts with the traditional architecture of Parisian churches. Its design is a harmony of geometric shapes, from which a large illuminated cross emerges, symbolizing faith and hope. The interior is just as impressive with a celestial vault evoking a starry sky, offering a contemplative and serene atmosphere. The large stained glass window, with its color variations, breathes a soft and soothing luminosity. The Don Bosco Church is therefore a perfect example of how contemporary architecture can give a new dimension to religious spaces, making them both welcoming and inspiring.

Saint-Jean-Bosco, little-known masterpiece of Art Deco (79 rue Alexandre Dumas 20th).  Murals, frescoes, mosaics, stained glass windows, statues... The interior of the church offers an extraordinary diversity of decor, created by the greatest religious art artists of the time. Even the chairs date from 1938. The bell tower is 53 meters high. The church has a crypt dedicated to Saint Anne. A must see if you are passing through the neighborhood.
Super, church, completely atypical, modern contemporary, full of little surprises
A very beautiful art deco style architecture with very beautiful stained glass windows inside. A very pleasant discovery.

In Art Nouveau style, it was built between 1937 and 1938. It was the architect Dimitri Rotter and his son, René who created the church which were inspired by Perret who had designed the Raincy church. Richly decorated with numerous mosaics and magnificent stained glass windows, let yourself be carried away in what was in its time considered one of the most successful and homogeneous churches of those built in the 1930s.  To visit with curiosity!

Church from 1938, in a “worker” art deco style. Very beautiful lighting inside thanks to the stained glass windows which fully let in a beautiful colored light. Many art deco tiles on the walls. The confessionals have been transformed into display cases where you can admire beautiful priestly outfits. Also note the Chair in the Art Deco style.
Magnificent atypical church, magnificent stained glass windows, with strong symbols. The origami nativity scene is beautiful and original to match this church. To have !
Very beautiful architecture from the beginning of the last century

The Saint-Jean-Bosco Church is located in the 20th arrondissement of Paris. Away from the usual walking routes, it can be accessed for example from the Alexandre Dumas metro station, going up rue Bagnolet. Its exterior architecture is interesting, as is its interior, in Art Deco style: Walls and stained glass windows are to be admired.

Unique. We are amazed by the Lego-style architecture on the outside, and the colorful interior is surprising. To be discovered by tourists and also Parisians during a detour in the 20th arrondissement.
Beautiful church tucked away on the corner of 2 small streets, with an incredible carillon!
Very beautiful and surprising art deco church.

✨Take the trouble to enter this church whose art deco style facade is already a feast for the eyes: ✨You will be dazzled by the purple stained glass windows which illuminate the interior differently depending on the time of day.
Art deco, managed by the Salesians, this church exudes spirituality and recursion
Very beautiful building!! Very impressive both outside and inside
A very beautiful, one-of-a-kind church! A5 see!
Grand on the outside and magnificent on the inside
It is a place so beautiful that it is difficult to breathe. Mural mosaic painting. Even the stained glass.. ha.. thank you.

Curious art deco church. Very interesting to visit due to its totally different style. In addition to its architecture, it is joyful to see the great community life that develops there. Lots of young people and masses that touch the heart.
An absolutely magnificent church and a beautiful art deco monument.
Bravo to the Choir of the 20th Conservatory who performed works by Ola Gjeilo, a Norwegian composer. Beautiful art deco style church.

Church wedged between 2 buildings, so at night, not easy to find! Two flights of markets interest me on the sides up to the central entrance, then door to the right. Well-lit church, with superb wall and ceiling paintings and a warm atmosphere. Excellent acoustics for a concert and lyrical singing.

Superb church to see because it is very interesting in its architecture and its stained glass windows. The mosaics are sublime too. The only downside was the lack of lighting which prevented us from admiring the ceilings and the floor.

It is a very large and beautiful church, as impressive and cold on the outside as it is warm on the inside. It is superbly well decorated and clothes and objects from old times have been brought back to life. It's always nice to come here.
Magnificent art deco church, unique in its kind in Paris. Relic of St John Bosco inside.  Stained glass windows of unparalleled splendor. Absolutely worth discovering.

A wonderful sanctuary where incredible energy is felt. I invite anyone passing through or from the neighborhood to come in, sit down and breathe. The stained glass windows play with the light and the sun's rays dazzling the walls with a thousand colors.
Very amazing church in art deco style
